Command or Action
enable Example: Device> enable
configure terminal Example: Device# configure terminal
router bgp autonomous-system-number Example: Device(config)# router bgp 100
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} remote-as as-number Example: Device(config-router)# neighbor 192.168.2.1 remote-as 100
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} update-source interface-type interface-number Example: Device(config-router)# neighbor 192.168.2.1 update-source Loopback 0
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address| peer-group-name} ebgp-multihop [ttl] Example: Device(config-router)# neighbor 192.168.2.1 ebgp-multihop
address-family vpnv6 [unicast] Example: Device(config-router)# address-family vpnv6
neighbor {ip-address | peer-group-name | ipv6-address} activate Example: Device(config-router-af)# neighbor 192.168.2.1 activate
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} send-community [both | standard | extended] Example: Device(config-router-af)# neighbor 192.168.2.1 send-community extended
neighbor {ip-address | ipv6-address | peer-group-name} next-hop-unchanged [allpaths] Example: Device(config-router-af)# neighbor 192.168.2.1 next-hop-unchanged allpaths
Purpose
Enables privileged EXEC mode. Enter your password if prompted.
Enters global configuration mode.
Configures the BGP routing process.
Adds an entry to the multiprotocol BGP neighbor table for eBGP peering with RR2.
Enables the BGP session to use a source address on the specified interface.
(Optional) Accepts and attempts BGP connections to external peers residing on networks that are not directly connected.
(Optional) Places the device in address family configuration mode for configuring routing sessions.
Enables the exchange of information for this address family with the specified BGP neighbor.
Specifies that a communities attribute should be sent to the BGP neighbor.
Enables an eBGP multihop peer to propagate to the next hop unchanged for paths.
